      public MathUtils()

  • Method Details

    • remapRange

      public static double remapRange(double old_min, double old_max, double new_min, double new_max, double value)
      Squishes or expands the range a value is in from the old to new range, changing the value. If a value is 1 in the range [0, 2], it would be 2 in the range [0, 4] for example.
      Parameters:
      old_min - Old range minimum
      old_max - Old range maximum
      new_min - New range minimum
      new_max - New range maximum
      value - Value to remap
      Returns:
      The remapped value

    • clamp

      public static double clamp(double min, double max, double value)
      clamps a value in a range. Returns min if value < min, max if value > max, and value otherwise
      Parameters:
      min - minimum value in range
      max - maximum value in range
      value - value that needs to be clamped
      Returns:
      the clamped value

    • sqr

      public static int sqr(int x)
      squares an int
      Parameters:
      x - the number to square
      Returns:
      the int, squared

    • sqr

      public static double sqr(double x)
      squares a double
      Parameters:
      x - the number to square
      Returns:
      the double, squared

    • findMedian

      public static double findMedian(int[] a)
      returns median value in an array
      Parameters:
      a - integer array
      Returns:
      the median value of the array

    • smallestDiff

      public static int smallestDiff(int[] nums, int value)
      returns the number in an array closest to the given value
      Parameters:
      nums - array of integers to compare to value
      value - number to compare to
      Returns:
      returns double closest to value

    • shortestAngleRemapped

      public static double shortestAngleRemapped(double targetAngle, double currentAngle)
      Finds a value from -1 to 1 representing how much the robot needs to turn to reach the given target angle
      Parameters:
      currentAngle - the current angle of the robot in degrees
      targetAngle - than angle in degrees you want the robot to face
      Returns:
      Value from -1 to 1 representing how much the robot should turn to reach the current angle. This value can be plugged as the turn constant in the driving code
